source.name: City of San Antonio Solid Waste Management
source.notes: Based on City of San Antonio Solid Waste Management Department recycling and organics guidelines. Single-use plastic bags banned from blue cart since August 2024.

materials.name: Plastic bottles
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Keep caps on bottles in San Antonio
No monthly fee for blue cart
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid still in them

materials.name: Yogurt cups
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Yogurt cups are specifically accepted in San Antonio's blue cart
commonMistakes: Rinse out all dairy residue before recycling

materials.name: Plastic containers
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Rigid plastic containers accepted
commonMistakes: No styrofoam containers
No single-use plastic bags

materials.name: Aluminum cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Aluminum is infinitely recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't crush cans; leave them whole for sorting

materials.name: Steel / tin cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Labels can stay on
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food still in them

materials.name: Glass bottles and jars
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Glass is accepted curbside in San Antonio unlike some TX cities
commonMistakes: Don't include broken glass; wrap and trash it
Don't include ceramics or mirrors

materials.name: Cardboard
instructions: Flatten all boxes
Remove packing materials
Place in or beside blue recycling cart
notes: Flattening is required in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't include cardboard soaked with grease
Remove styrofoam inserts

materials.name: Dry goods packaging
instructions: Flatten
Remove plastic liner bags (trash them)
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Dry goods packaging is specifically called out as accepted in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't forget to remove plastic liners

materials.name: Office paper and junk mail
instructions: Place in blue recycling cart
No need to remove staples or paper clips
notes: Office paper and junk mail specifically accepted in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels or tissues
Don't bag paper in plastic bags

materials.name: Newspapers and magazines
instructions: Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Newspapers and magazines specifically listed as accepted
commonMistakes: Don't bag in plastic
Remove plastic wrapping first

materials.name: Drink boxes / cartons
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap if it has one
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Drink boxes are specifically accepted in San Antonio's blue cart
commonMistakes: Don't crush; leave them as-is

materials.name: Aerosol cans
instructions: Must be completely empty
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Non-empty aerosols are hazardous waste
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized

materials.name: Aluminum foil
instructions: Clean off all food residue
Ball up into a fist-sized ball
Place in blue recycling cart
notes: Only clean aluminum foil is recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily soiled foil; trash it

materials.name: Plastic bags
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
Single-use plastic bags banned from blue cart since August 2024
Take to H-E-B or Walmart for store drop-off recycling
Otherwise place in brown trash cart
notes: San Antonio removed plastic bags from blue cart recycling in August 2024
Bags jam recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags
Don't put any film plastic in the blue cart

materials.name: Styrofoam
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Not accepted in blue recycling cart
notes: Styrofoam is not recyclable in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't put styrofoam in recycling

materials.name: Food waste (all types)
instructions: Place in green organics cart
All food scraps accepted including meat, dairy, and bones
No plastic bags; use paper bags or go loose
notes: Green organics cart is free; no monthly fee
$25 contamination fee if non-organic items found ($50 for diapers)
commonMistakes: Don't put food in brown trash cart; use the green cart
Don't use plastic bags to line the green cart

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Place in green organics cart
Large branches: cut to 4 feet or shorter
Yard waste collected weekly with green cart
notes: Green cart accepts both food scraps and yard waste together
No monthly fee for green organics cart
commonMistakes: Don't bag yard waste in plastic bags
Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Food-soiled paper
instructions: Place in green organics cart
Pizza boxes, paper plates, napkins, paper towels all go in green cart when food-soiled
notes: Food-soiled paper cannot be recycled but can be composted
commonMistakes: Don't put food-soiled paper in the blue recycling cart
Food-soiled paper is NOT trash; compost it in the green cart

materials.name: Fruit / fruit scraps
instructions: Place in green organics cart
All fruit and fruit scraps accepted
notes: Green cart is free in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't put fruit in brown trash cart; compost it

materials.name: Vegetables / vegetable scraps
instructions: Place in green organics cart
notes: All vegetables accepted in San Antonio composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in brown trash cart

materials.name: Meat and bones
instructions: Place in green organics cart
Raw and cooked meat, fish, poultry, and bones all accepted
notes: San Antonio's green cart accepts all food including meat and bones
commonMistakes: Don't put in brown trash cart; use the green organics cart
Both raw and cooked accepted

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: Place dairy products in green organics cart
Pour expired milk down drain; compost the residue
notes: San Antonio's composting accepts dairy
commonMistakes: Rinse and recycle the container separately in blue cart

materials.name: Bread and grains
instructions: Place in green organics cart
notes: All grain products accepted in green cart
commonMistakes: Don't put in brown trash cart

materials.name: Coffee grounds / tea bags
instructions: Coffee grounds and paper filters: green organics cart
Paper tea bags: green cart
notes: Coffee grounds are great for composting
commonMistakes: Check that tea bags are paper, not plastic mesh

materials.name: Eggs / eggshells
instructions: Place eggshells in green organics cart
notes: Eggshells add calcium to compost
commonMistakes: Crush shells for faster breakdown

materials.name: Diapers
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Never place in green organics cart
notes: $50 contamination fee if diapers found in green organics cart
This is the highest contamination penalty in San Antonio
commonMistakes: NEVER put diapers in the green organics cart; $50 fine

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Do not put in trash or recycling
Take to a San Antonio household hazardous waste collection event
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries before transport
notes: San Antonio holds periodic HHW collection events
commonMistakes: Don't throw batteries in trash
Don't put in blue cart

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Take to San Antonio Bulky Waste and Brush Collection
Best Buy also accepts e-waste
Delete personal data before disposal
notes: Texas law prohibits putting certain e-waste in the trash
commonMistakes: Don't put electronics in trash or recycling

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Take to San Antonio household hazardous waste collection event
Latex paint: can dry out with kitty litter and trash it
Oil-based paint: must go to hazardous waste
notes: San Antonio holds HHW collection events throughout the year
commonMistakes: Don't pour paint down the drain

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to San Antonio household hazardous waste collection event
AutoZone and O'Reilly also accept used oil
notes: Most auto parts stores accept oil for free
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains or into soil

materials.name: Medications
instructions: Take to a San Antonio police department drug take-back location
CVS and Walgreens participate in take-back programs
If no drop-off available: mix with coffee grounds, seal in bag, and trash
notes: DEA hosts periodic National Prescription Drug Take Back events
commonMistakes: Don't flush medications
Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Clothing and textiles
instructions: Donate to Goodwill, Salvation Army, or local thrift stores
Textile recycling bins available at various locations
Even worn-out textiles can go in textile bins
notes: San Antonio has many donation centers throughout the city
commonMistakes: Don't put clothing in curbside recycling

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL and fluorescent: take to HHW collection event or Home Depot/Lowe's
LED bulbs: e-waste recycling
Incandescent: wrap and place in brown trash cart
notes: CFL bulbs contain mercury and need special handling
commonMistakes: Don't put CFL bulbs in trash

materials.name: Candy wrapper
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Metallized plastic film is not recyclable
notes: Candy wrappers look metallic but are not aluminum
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling or compost

materials.name: Chip bag
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Metallized plastic film is not recyclable
notes: The shiny interior is aluminum bonded to plastic
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Fast food wrapper
instructions: Food-soiled fast food wrappers: green organics cart
Clean paper wrappers: blue recycling cart
notes: Food-soiled paper is compostable in San Antonio
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy wrappers in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Disposable coffee cups
instructions: Most lined paper cups: brown trash cart
Plastic lids: blue recycling cart
Paper sleeve: blue recycling cart
notes: The plastic/wax lining prevents paper cup recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put lined cups in recycling

materials.name: Receipts
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Thermal paper contains BPA; do not recycle or compost
notes: Thermal receipts contaminate recycling streams
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Cooking oil / grease
instructions: Collect in a sealed container
Take to a San Antonio household hazardous waste event
Never pour down the drain
notes: Grease causes sewer blockages
commonMistakes: Don't pour down sink or storm drains

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Take to San Antonio HHW collection event
Never put in trash or recycling
notes: Pressurized containers are fire and explosion risks
commonMistakes: Never puncture

materials.name: Needles / sharps
instructions: Place in FDA-cleared sharps container
Take to a San Antonio hazardous waste drop-off
notes: Never place loose sharps in trash
commonMistakes: Never put in recycling or loose in trash

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Schedule a bulky item pickup with San Antonio 311
Or take to a City of San Antonio brush/bulky waste site
notes: San Antonio offers bulk item collection by appointment
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Large / bulk items
instructions: Schedule bulk pickup through SA 311 or online
Place at curb on scheduled day
notes: San Antonio provides bulk/brush collection by appointment
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling

materials.name: Chargers and cables
instructions: Take to Best Buy or e-waste recycler
Do NOT put in blue recycling cart
notes: Cables tangle in recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Never put cables in curbside recycling

materials.name: Smartphone / phone
instructions: Factory reset first
Trade in at carrier stores or Apple/Samsung
Take to Best Buy for free recycling
notes: Phones contain valuable recoverable metals
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe personal data

materials.name: Pet waste
instructions: Bag and place in brown trash cart
Do NOT compost pet waste
notes: Pet waste contains harmful bacteria
$25 contamination fee if found in green cart
commonMistakes: Never put pet waste in the green organics cart

materials.name: Wax paper / parchment paper
instructions: Place in green organics cart
notes: Wax-coated paper is compostable
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Bubble wrap / packing materials
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Or drop off plastic film at store collection bins
notes: Plastic film jams recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Books
instructions: Donate if in good condition to San Antonio Public Library or Goodwill
If damaged, recycle paper pages in blue cart
Remove hardcover bindings with glossy laminate (trash them)
notes: Donating is always better than recycling
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in trash

materials.name: Snacks and candy (food)
instructions: The food: green organics cart
The wrapper: brown trash cart
notes: Separate food from wrapper
commonMistakes: Don't put wrappers in green cart; $25 contamination fee

materials.name: Condiments and sauces
instructions: The sauce/condiment: green organics cart
The bottle/container: rinse and put in blue recycling cart
notes: Separate container from contents
commonMistakes: Don't recycle bottles with sauce still in them

materials.name: Beverages / drinks
instructions: Pour leftover liquid down drain
Recycle the container in blue cart (cans, plastic bottles, glass)
notes: Focus on recycling the container
commonMistakes: Don't recycle containers with liquid still in them

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to tire retailer or San Antonio brush/bulky waste site
Most shops accept old tires when you buy new ones
notes: Illegal to dump tires
commonMistakes: Don't dump illegally

materials.name: Mirrors
instructions: Wrap carefully and place in brown trash cart
Label as BROKEN GLASS if broken
notes: Metallic coating prevents glass recycling
commonMistakes: Never put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Ink / toner cartridges
instructions: Return to Staples or Office Depot
Manufacturers offer mail-back programs
notes: Some stores give credit for returns
commonMistakes: Don't throw in trash

materials.name: Fluorescent tubes
instructions: Take to San Antonio HHW collection event
Home Depot and Lowe's also accept them
notes: Contains mercury; handle carefully
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash
Don't break them

materials.name: Toothbrush
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
notes: Mixed plastic; not recyclable curbside
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Makeup / cosmetics
instructions: Most containers go in brown trash cart
Clean empty rigid plastic containers may be recyclable
notes: Check brand take-back programs like MAC Back to MAC
commonMistakes: Small items fall through sorting screens

materials.name: Plastic utensils / straws
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Not recyclable
notes: Too small and lightweight for recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart

materials.name: Shredded paper
instructions: Place in brown trash cart
Shredded paper jams recycling equipment
notes: Shredded paper fibers are too short to recycle effectively
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling cart; pieces fall through screens

materials.name: Hangers
instructions: Wire hangers: take to dry cleaner for reuse
Plastic hangers: brown trash cart
Do not put in blue recycling cart
notes: Hangers jam sorting equipment at recycling facilities
commonMistakes: Don't put any hangers in blue recycling cart

compost: All food scraps (fruit, vegetables, meat, dairy, bones)
Food-soiled paper (pizza boxes, napkins, paper towels, paper plates)
trash: Plastic bags and film (banned from blue cart since Aug 2024)
Candy wrappers, chip bags, snack pouches

tips: Blue and green carts have NO monthly fee
Keep caps ON bottles in the blue cart
Single-use plastic bags banned from blue cart since August 2024
$25 contamination fee for non-organic items in green cart ($50 for diapers)
Flatten all cardboard before placing in blue cart
Brown trash cart size determines your pay-as-you-throw cost
Food-soiled paper goes in the green organics cart, not blue recycling
